newsitem.title: CHINA: Iran oil minister in China, seeks oil cooperation.
newsitem.headline: Iran oil minister in China, seeks oil cooperation.

text.p: Iranian Oil Minister Gholamreza Aghazadeh is visiting China to discuss joint oil and gas exploration and boosting his nation's crude exports, an Iranian embassy spokesman said on Friday.

Aghazadeh arrived in Beijing late on Thursday and has met officials of the state-run China National Petroleum Corp, the spokesman said. He will also meet officials of China's state oil refiner Sinopec.
"The Iranian side is seeking cooperation with Chinese oil companies...with regards to exploration of oil and gas...in Iran," the spokesman said.
China and Iran currently have no joint ventures in the oil sector.
"They (Chinese) are also seeking to take more crude oil from Iran," the spokesman said.
He declined to say how much additional oil Beijing wanted to buy. Iran currently exports 70,000 barrels per day to China.
"They have just started the negotiations... They have not reached any conclusions," the spokesman said.
Chinese oil officials were not immediately available for comment.
China's oil imports have been rising sharply, spurred by growing demand as the nation's economy expands rapidly.
Domestic production, once sufficient to make China a net oil exporter, has been unable to keep pace with surging demand.
Aghazadeh will stop in Shanghai on Saturday and leave for home on Sunday.
